Job Title: Director for EHS (Environmental, Health, Safety and Quality Assurance)

Location: New York, NY

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Management, Manufacturing

Description:
In a world of possibilities, pursue one with endless opportunities. Imagine Next!

When it comes to what you want in your career, if you can imagine it, you can do it at Parsons. Imagine a career working with intelligent, diverse people sharing a common quest. Imagine a workplace where you can be yourself. Where you can thrive. Where you can find your next, right now. We’ve got what you’re looking for.

Job Description

Parsons is seeking an amazingly talented Director for EHS (Environmental, Health, Safety and Quality Assurance) to join our team! In this role, you will get to support a large operations contract in the State of New York.

The job is near Albany, New York.

What You’ll Be Doing

Directs and oversees subordinates to establish project schedule and budget, and monitors progress in meeting schedule and budget requirements.Approves project documents, processes, and procedures required to support quality control and final project deliverables including:Directs the project team leadership to determine the number of hours required for the successful completion of project tasks. Anticipates project staffing needs, identifies and interviews available personnel, and makes staffing assignments in accordance with schedule requirements.Establishes objectives and conducts performance appraisals for direct reports.Establishes a project safety plan and ensures that it is communicated to all employees on the job site. Actively promotes and supports safety policies and monitors the job site for good safety practices.Approves all required legal notices at the job site.Approves site security measures and monitors site access by subcontractors and others.Approves pricing and negotiating changes to the scope of work with the client and subcontractors. Reviews bid documents and assists with bidder solicitation activities. Documents and executes changes in the scope of the project.Anticipates problems and works with clients, architects/engineers, subcontractors, and direct reports to identify and implement corrective actions.Keeps client and PM informed of the day-to-day activities of the project.Maintains accurate documentation of job progress through daily logs and other reports.Performs other responsibilities associated with this position as may be appropriate.
What Skills You’ll Bring

20 + years of related experience, with more than 10 years successfully leading diverse teams in the completion of environmental remediation projects involving hazardous materials and radioactive constituents.Experience on DOE projects required.Exceptional leadership skills and excellent written and oral communication skills.3+ years in a leadership role at a field site.Enrollment and certification in PM certification programBachelor's Degree in a technical field (engineering or chemistry preferred)Safety training completed for radiological and chemical hazardsExperience in New York state a plus


Minimum Clearance Required To Start

Not Applicable/None

This position is part of our Federal Solutions team.

Our Federal Solutions segment delivers resources to our US government customers that ensure the success of missions around the globe. Our diverse, intelligent employees drive the state of the art as they provide services and solutions in the areas of defense, security, intelligence, infrastructure, and environmental. We promote a culture of excellence and close-knit teams that take pride in delivering, protecting, and sustaining our nation's most critical assets, from Earth to cyberspace. Throughout the company, our people are anticipating what’s next to deliver the solutions our customers need now.

Salary Range

$117,000.00 - $210,600.00

We value our employees and want our employees to take care of their overall wellbeing, which is why we offer best-in-class benefits such as medical, dental, vision, paid time off, Employee Stock Ownership Plan (ESOP), 401(k), life insurance, flexible work schedules, and holidays to fit your busy lifestyle!

The position may require a COVID vaccination or an approved accommodation/exemption for a disability/medical condition or religious belief as required by customer requirements and some cases federal, state, provincial or local mandates.

Parsons is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity, equity, inclusion, and accessibility in the workplace. Diversity is ingrained in who we are, how we do business, and is one of our company’s core values. Parsons equally employs representation at all job levels for minority, female, disabled, protected veteran and LGBTQ+.

We truly invest and care about our employee’s wellbeing and provide endless growth opportunities as the sky is the limit, so aim for the stars! Imagine next and join the Parsons quest—APPLY TODAY!

Experience Level (if available): Director
